+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownListener.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,28 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.thread.listener;
+
+/**
+ * Any component which needs to be shut down should implement this interface
+ * and use the function to shut down the component.
+ */
+public interface ShutdownListener {
+
+    /**
+     * The function to run when the system shutdown.
+     */
+    public void shutdown();
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilthreadlistenerShutdownManagerjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilthreadlistenerShutdownManagerjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownManager.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownManager.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownManager.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownManager.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.thread.listener;
+
+/**
+ * Interface used by shutdown managers to allow for thread safe
+ * adding and removing of shutdown listeners.
+ */
+public interface ShutdownManager {
+
+    /**
+     * Adds a ShutdownListener to this ShutdownManager with the default priority.
+     *
+     * @param listener The listener to be added.
+     */
+    void addShutdownListener(ShutdownListener listener);
+
+    /**
+     * Adds a ShutdownListener to this ShutdownManager with the supplied priority.
+     *
+     * @param listener The listener to be added.
+     * @param priority The priority of the listener when added.
+     */
+    void addShutdownListener(ShutdownListener listener, ShutdownPriority priority);
+
+    /**
+     * Reaplces an existing ShutdownListener with the new ShutdownListener.
+     *
+     * @param oldListener To be replaced.
+     * @param newListener The replacement.
+     * @param priority Replacement listeners priority.
+     */
+    void replaceShutdownListener(ShutdownListener oldListener, ShutdownListener newListener, ShutdownPriority priority);
+
+    /**
+     * Removes a ShutdownListener from this ShutdownManager.
+     *
+     * @param listener The listener to be removed.
+     */
+    void removeShutdownListener(ShutdownListener listener);
+
+    /**
+     * Shuts down all the listeners in this ShutdownManager.
+     */
+    void shutdown();
+
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilthreadlistenerShutdownPriorityjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilthreadlistenerShutdownPriorityjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownPriority.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownPriority.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownPriority.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/thread/listener/ShutdownPriority.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,71 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.thread.listener;
+
+import java.util.Arrays;
+import java.util.List;
+
+/**
+ * This class defines the shutdown priorities that are consumed by
+ * &lt;code&gt;com.sun.identity.common.ShutdownManager&lt;/code&gt;.
+ */
+public enum ShutdownPriority {
+
+    /**
+     * HIGHEST is the priority pre-defined in the system. Components which are
+     * registered with this priority will be shutdown first.
+     */
+    HIGHEST(3),
+
+    /**
+     * DEFAULT is the priority pre-defined in the system. Components which are
+     * registered with this priority will be shutdown after the componets with
+     * HIGHEST priority.
+     */
+    DEFAULT(2),
+
+    /**
+     * LOWEST is the priority pre-defined in the system. Components which are
+     * registered with this priority will be shutdown after the componets with
+     * HIGHEST or DEFAULT priority.
+     */
+    LOWEST(1);
+
+    private int priority;
+    
+    private ShutdownPriority(int priority) {
+        this.priority = priority;
+    }
+    
+    /**
+     * Returns the priority.
+     *
+     * @return the priority.
+     */
+    public int getIntValue() {
+        return priority;
+    }
+    
+    /**
+     * Returns list of all the priorities (ordered from the highest to the
+     * lowest priority) defined in the system.
+     *
+     * @return list of all the priorities defined in the system.
+     */
+    public static List&lt;ShutdownPriority&gt; getPriorities() {
+        return Arrays.asList(values());
+    }
+} 
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcmainjavaorgforgerockutiltimeTimeServicejavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcmainjavaorgforgerockutiltimeTimeServicejava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/time/TimeService.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/time/TimeService.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/time/TimeService.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/time/TimeService.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,107 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.time;
+
+/**
+ * Provides time related methods for computing durations, for providing the now
+ * instant and other use cases.
+ * &lt;p&gt;
+ * Why using a service interface instead of JVM provided time methods?
+ * &lt;p&gt;
+ * Simply because you gain better control over the time understood by the
+ * application. For example, if you would have to code an expiration time logic,
+ * you would check periodically if the computed expiration timestamp is greater
+ * than the now timestamp. So far, so good.
+ * &lt;p&gt;
+ * When it comes to testing, things gets worst: you typically have to use
+ * {@link Thread#sleep(long)} to wait for a given amount of time so that your
+ * expiration date is reached. That makes tests much longer to execute and
+ * somehow brittle when you're testing short timeouts.
+ * &lt;p&gt;
+ * Using a {@link TimeService} helps you to keep your code readable and provides
+ * a way to better control how the time is flowing for your application
+ * (especially useful in the tests).
+ * &lt;p&gt;
+ * For example, {@link #now()} is used in place of
+ * {@link System#currentTimeMillis()}. in your code and you can easily mock it
+ * and make it return controlled values. Here is an example with &lt;a
+ * href=&quot;https://code.google.com/p/mockito/&quot;&gt;Mockito&lt;/a&gt;:
+ *
+ * &lt;pre&gt;
+ * &amp;#064;Mock
+ * private TimeService time;
+ *
+ * &amp;#064;BeforeMethod
+ * public void setUp() throws Exception {
+ *     MockitoAnnotations.initMocks(this);
+ * }
+ *
+ * &amp;#064;Test
+ * public shouldAdvanceInTime() throws Exception {
+ *     // Mimics steps in the future at each call
+ *     when(time.now()).thenReturn(0L, 1000L, 10000L);
+ *
+ *     assertThat(time.now()).isEqualTo(0L);
+ *     assertThat(time.now()).isEqualTo(1000L);
+ *     assertThat(time.now()).isEqualTo(10000L);
+ * }
+ * &lt;/pre&gt;
+ *
+ * TimeService provides a {@linkplain #SYSTEM default service implementation}
+ * using the System provided time methods for ease of use.
+ *
+ * @see System#currentTimeMillis()
+ * @since 1.3.4
+ */
+public interface TimeService {
+
+    /**
+     * {@link TimeService} implementation based on {@link System}.
+     *
+     * @see System#currentTimeMillis()
+     * @since 1.3.4
+     */
+    TimeService SYSTEM = new TimeService() {
+        @Override
+        public long now() {
+            return System.currentTimeMillis();
+        }
+
+        @Override
+        public long since(final long past) {
+            return now() - past;
+        }
+    };
+
+    /**
+     * Returns a value that represents &quot;now&quot; since the epoch.
+     *
+     * @return a value that represents &quot;now&quot; since the epoch.
+     * @since 1.3.4
+     */
+    long now();
+
+    /**
+     * Computes the elapsed time between {@linkplain #now() now} and {@code past}.
+     *
+     * @param past
+     *         time value to compare to now.
+     * @return the elapsed time
+     * @since 1.3.4
+     */
+    long since(long past);
+
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcmainjavaorgforgerockutiltimepackageinfojavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcmainjavaorgforgerockutiltimepackageinfojava"></a>

</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,21 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+/**
+ * Provides a time service abstraction.
+ *
+ * @since 1.3.4
+ */
+package org.forgerock.util.time;
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilxmlXMLHandlerjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilxmlXMLHandlerjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLHandler.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLHandler.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLHandler.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLHandler.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,62 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.xml;
+
+import java.io.InputStream;
+import java.io.StringReader;
+
+import org.xml.sax.InputSource;
+import org.xml.sax.helpers.DefaultHandler;
+
+/**
+ * This is a custom XML handler to load the dtds from the classpath This should
+ * be used by all the xml parsing document builders to set the default entity
+ * resolvers. This will avoid to have the dtds having specified in a fixed
+ * directory that will get replaced during installation This will need to
+ * specify the dtds as follows jar://com/sun/identity/sm/sms.dtd Bundle all the
+ * dtds along with the jar files and
+ */
+public class XMLHandler extends DefaultHandler {
+
+    /* FIXME: does this class need to be non-final and public? */
+
+    /**
+     * Creates a new XML handler.
+     */
+    public XMLHandler() {
+        // No impl.
+    }
+
+    @Override
+    public InputSource resolveEntity(final String aPublicID, final String aSystemID) {
+        final String sysid = aSystemID.trim();
+
+        if (sysid.toLowerCase().startsWith(&quot;jar://&quot;)) {
+            final String dtdname = sysid.substring(5);
+            final InputStream is = getClass().getResourceAsStream(dtdname);
+            if (is != null) {
+                return new InputSource(is);
+            }
+        }
+
+        /*
+         * make sure that we do NOT return null here, as xerces would fall back
+         * to the default entity resolver and try to resolve the entity with
+         * that
+         */
+        return new InputSource(new StringReader(&quot;&quot;));
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilxmlXMLUtilsjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcmainjavaorgforgerockutilxmlXMLUtilsjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLUtils.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLUtils.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLUtils.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/main/java/org/forgerock/util/xml/XMLUtils.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,79 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.util.xml;
+
+import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
+
+import javax.xml.XMLConstants;
+import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilder;
+import javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory;
+import javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException;
+import javax.xml.parsers.SAXParser;
+import javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory;
+
+/**
+ * Utility classes for handling XML.
+ */
+public final class XMLUtils {
+    private XMLUtils() {
+        // No impl.
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Provides a secure DocumentBuilder implementation, which is protected against
+     * different types of entity expansion attacks and makes sure that only locally
+     * available DTDs can be referenced within the XML document.
+     * @param validating Whether the returned DocumentBuilder should validate input.
+     * @return A secure DocumentBuilder instance.
+     * @throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException In case xerces does not support one
+     * of the required features.
+     */
+    public static DocumentBuilder getSafeDocumentBuilder(boolean validating) throws ParserConfigurationException {
+        DocumentBuilderFactory dbf = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
+        dbf.setValidating(validating);
+        dbf.setNamespaceAware(true);
+        dbf.setXIncludeAware(false);
+        dbf.setFeature(&quot;http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities&quot;, false);
+        dbf.setFeature(&quot;http://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities&quot;, false);
+        dbf.setFeature(XMLConstants.FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING, true);
+        DocumentBuilder db = dbf.newDocumentBuilder();
+        db.setEntityResolver(new XMLHandler());
+        return db;
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Provides a secure SAXParser instance, which is protected against different
+     * types of entity expension, DoS attacks and makes sure that only locally
+     * available DTDs can be referenced within the XML document.
+     * @param validating Whether the returned DocumentBuilder should validate input.
+     * @return A secure SAXParser instance.
+     * @throws ParserConfigurationException In case Xerces does not support one of
+     * the required features.
+     * @throws SAXException In case Xerces does not support one of the required
+     * features.
+     */
+    public static SAXParser getSafeSAXParser(boolean validating) throws ParserConfigurationException, SAXException {
+        SAXParserFactory saxFactory = SAXParserFactory.newInstance();
+        saxFactory.setValidating(validating);
+        saxFactory.setNamespaceAware(true);
+        saxFactory.setXIncludeAware(false);
+        saxFactory.setFeature(&quot;http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities&quot;, false);
+        saxFactory.setFeature(&quot;http://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities&quot;, false);
+        saxFactory.setFeature(XMLConstants.FEATURE_SECURE_PROCESSING, true);
+        SAXParser sp = saxFactory.newSAXParser();
+        sp.getXMLReader().setEntityResolver(new XMLHandler());
+        return sp;
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcsitesitexmlfromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcsitesitexml"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/site/site.xml (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/site/site.xml) (0 => 3004)</h4>

<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrcsitexdocindexxmlvmfromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrcsitexdocindexxmlvm"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/site/xdoc/index.xml.vm (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/site/xdoc/index.xml.vm) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/site/xdoc/index.xml.vm                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/site/xdoc/index.xml.vm        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
</span><ins>+&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot;?&gt;
+&lt;!--
+  ! CCPL HEADER START
+  !

+  ! http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/3.0/
+  ! or send a letter to Creative Commons, 444 Castro Street,
+  ! Suite 900, Mountain View, California, 94041, USA.
+  !

+  ! and limitations under the License.
+  !
+  ! If applicable, add the following below this CCPL HEADER, with the fields
+  ! enclosed by brackets &quot;[]&quot; replaced with your own identifying information:
+  !      Portions Copyright [yyyy] [name of copyright owner]
+  !
+  ! CCPL HEADER END
+  !
+  !      Copyright 2014 ForgeRock AS
+  !
+--&gt;
+&lt;document
+ xmlns=&quot;http://maven.apache.org/XDOC/2.0&quot;
+ xmlns:xsi=&quot;http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance&quot;
+ xsi:schemaLocation=&quot;http://maven.apache.org/XDOC/2.0
+                     http://maven.apache.org/xsd/xdoc-2.0.xsd&quot;&gt;
+ &lt;properties&gt;
+
+  &lt;title&gt;${project.name}&lt;/title&gt;
+  &lt;author email=&quot;commons@forgerock.org&quot;&gt;ForgeRock AS&lt;/author&gt;
+ &lt;/properties&gt;
+ &lt;body&gt;
+  &lt;section name=&quot;About ${project.name}&quot;&gt;
+
+   &lt;p&gt;
+    ${project.description}
+   &lt;/p&gt;
+
+  &lt;/section&gt;
+ &lt;/body&gt;
+&lt;/document&gt;
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilIterablesTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilIterablesTestjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/IterablesTest.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/IterablesTest.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/IterablesTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/IterablesTest.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,200 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.util;
+
+import java.util.ArrayList;
+import java.util.Arrays;
+import java.util.Iterator;
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
+
+import org.forgerock.util.promise.Function;
+import org.forgerock.util.promise.NeverThrowsException;
+import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.assertThat;
+import static org.forgerock.util.Iterables.filter;
+import static org.forgerock.util.Iterables.from;
+import static org.forgerock.util.Iterables.map;
+
+
+/**
+ * Test the Iterables methods.
+ */
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class IterablesTest {
+
+    private static final Predicate&lt;String&gt; IGNORE_G_WORDS =
+            new Predicate&lt;String&gt;() {
+                @Override
+                public boolean apply(String s) {
+                    return !s.toLowerCase().startsWith(&quot;g&quot;);
+                }
+            };
+
+    private static final Predicate&lt;String&gt; ALWAYS_TRUE =
+            new Predicate&lt;String&gt;() {
+                @Override
+                public boolean apply(String s) {
+                    return true;
+                }
+            };
+
+    private static final Predicate&lt;String&gt; ALWAYS_FALSE =
+            new Predicate&lt;String&gt;() {
+                @Override
+                public boolean apply(String s) {
+                    return false;
+                }
+            };
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] filterCollections() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { new String[] { &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot;, &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;bah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot; }, &quot;bbz&quot; },
+                { new String[] { &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;baz&quot;, &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot; }, &quot;bbz&quot; },
+                { new String[] { &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;bah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot; }, &quot;bbz&quot; }
+
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;filterCollections&quot;)
+    public void testFilter(final String[] value, final String firstLetters) {
+        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
+        for (String element : filter(Arrays.asList(value), IGNORE_G_WORDS)) {
+            sb.append(element.charAt(0));
+        }
+        assertThat(sb.toString()).isEqualTo(firstLetters);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testNoElementsHasNext()
+    {
+        assertThat(filter(new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;(), ALWAYS_TRUE).iterator().hasNext()).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NoSuchElementException.class)
+    public void testNoElementsNext()
+    {
+        filter(new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;(), ALWAYS_TRUE).iterator().next();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testNextWithoutHasNextTruePredicate()
+    {
+        assertThat(filter(Arrays.asList(new String[] { &quot;a&quot; }), ALWAYS_TRUE).iterator().next()).isEqualTo(&quot;a&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NoSuchElementException.class)
+    public void testNextWithoutHasNextFalsePredicate()
+    {
+        filter(Arrays.asList(new String[] { &quot;a&quot; }), ALWAYS_FALSE).iterator().next();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testRemoveTruePredicate()
+    {
+        List&lt;String&gt; list = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();
+        list.add(&quot;a&quot;);
+        Iterator&lt;String&gt; iterator = filter(list, ALWAYS_TRUE).iterator();
+        assertThat(iterator.next()).isEqualTo(&quot;a&quot;);
+        iterator.remove();
+        assertThat(list.contains(&quot;a&quot;)).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalStateException.class)
+    public void testRemoveFalsePredicate()
+    {
+        List&lt;String&gt; list = new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;();
+        list.add(&quot;a&quot;);
+        filter(list, ALWAYS_FALSE).iterator().remove();
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalStateException.class)
+    public void testRemoveEmpty()
+    {
+        filter(new ArrayList&lt;String&gt;(), ALWAYS_TRUE).iterator().remove();
+    }
+
+    private static final Function&lt;String, Character, NeverThrowsException&gt; FIRST_LETTERS =
+            new Function&lt;String, Character, NeverThrowsException&gt;() {
+                @Override
+                public Character apply(String value) throws NeverThrowsException {
+                    return value.charAt(0);
+                }
+            };
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] mapCollections() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { new String[] { &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot;, &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;bah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot; }, &quot;ggbbz&quot; },
+                { new String[] { &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;baz&quot;, &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot; }, &quot;bbggz&quot; },
+                { new String[] { &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;bah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot; }, &quot;bgbzg&quot; }
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;mapCollections&quot;)
+    public void testMap(final String[] value, final String firstLetters) {
+        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
+        for (Character element : map(Arrays.asList(value), FIRST_LETTERS)) {
+            sb.append(element);
+        }
+        assertThat(sb.toString()).isEqualTo(firstLetters);
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;filterCollections&quot;)
+    public void test_Filter(final String[] value, final String firstLetters) {
+        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
+        for (String element : from(Arrays.asList(value)).filter(IGNORE_G_WORDS)) {
+            sb.append(element.charAt(0));
+        }
+        assertThat(sb.toString()).isEqualTo(firstLetters);
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;mapCollections&quot;)
+    public void test_Map(final String[] value, final String firstLetters) {
+        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
+        for (Character element : from(Arrays.asList(value)).map(FIRST_LETTERS)) {
+            sb.append(element);
+        }
+        assertThat(sb.toString()).isEqualTo(firstLetters);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] filterAndMapCollections() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { new String[] { &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot;, &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;bah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot; }, &quot;bbz&quot; },
+                { new String[] { &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;baz&quot;, &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot; }, &quot;bbz&quot; },
+                { new String[] { &quot;boo&quot;, &quot;goo&quot;, &quot;bah&quot;, &quot;zoo&quot;, &quot;gah&quot; }, &quot;bbz&quot; }
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;filterAndMapCollections&quot;)
+    public void test_FilterAndMap(final String[] value, final String firstLetters) {
+        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
+        for (Character element : from(Arrays.asList(value)).filter(IGNORE_G_WORDS).map(FIRST_LETTERS)) {
+            sb.append(element);
+        }
+        assertThat(sb.toString()).isEqualTo(firstLetters);
+    }
+
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilPairTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilPairTestjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/PairTest.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/PairTest.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/PairTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/PairTest.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,129 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.util;
+
+import java.math.BigDecimal;
+import java.util.Comparator;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+import static org.forgerock.util.Pair.*;
+
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.*;
+
+/**
+ * Tests the {@link Pair} class.
+ */
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class PairTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void getters() throws Exception {
+        final Pair&lt;BigDecimal, BigDecimal&gt; pair = of(BigDecimal.ONE, BigDecimal.TEN);
+        assertThat(pair.getFirst()).isSameAs(BigDecimal.ONE);
+        assertThat(pair.getSecond()).isSameAs(BigDecimal.TEN);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] pairsEqualDataProvider() {
+        final Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p12 = of(1, 2);
+        return new Object[][] {
+            { p12, p12 },
+            { p12, of(1, 2) },
+            { of(null, null), empty() },
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;pairsEqualDataProvider&quot;)
+    public void pairsEqual(Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p1, Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p2) {
+        assertThat(p1).isEqualTo(p2);
+        assertThat(p1.hashCode()).isEqualTo(p2.hashCode());
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void morePairsEqual() {
+        String left = &quot;left&quot;;
+        String right = &quot;right&quot;;
+
+        Pair&lt;String, String&gt; pairOne = Pair.of(left, right);
+        Pair&lt;String, String&gt; pairTwo = Pair.of(left, right);
+        Pair&lt;String, String&gt; pairThree = Pair.of(left, right);
+        Pair&lt;String, String&gt; pairFour = Pair.of(&quot;foo&quot;, &quot;bar&quot;);
+
+        // equals is reflexive
+        assertThat(pairOne).isEqualTo(pairOne);
+        assertThat(pairTwo).isEqualTo(pairTwo);
+        assertThat(pairThree).isEqualTo(pairThree);
+        assertThat(pairFour).isEqualTo(pairFour);
+
+        // symmetric
+        assertThat(pairOne).isEqualTo(pairTwo);
+        assertThat(pairTwo).isEqualTo(pairOne);
+
+        // transitive
+        assertThat(pairOne).isEqualTo(pairThree);
+        assertThat(pairTwo).isEqualTo(pairThree);
+        assertThat(pairThree).isEqualTo(pairOne);
+        assertThat(pairThree).isEqualTo(pairTwo);
+
+        assertThat(pairOne).isNotEqualTo(pairFour);
+        assertThat(pairTwo).isNotEqualTo(pairFour);
+        assertThat(pairFour).isNotEqualTo(pairOne);
+        assertThat(pairFour).isNotEqualTo(pairTwo);
+
+        Pair&lt;String, String&gt; backwards = Pair.of(right, left);
+
+        assertThat(pairOne).isNotEqualTo(backwards);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] pairsNotEqualDataProvider() {
+        final Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p12 = of(1, 2);
+        return new Object[][] {
+            { p12, null },
+            { p12, empty() },
+            { empty(), p12 },
+            { of(null, 2), empty() },
+            { empty(), of(null, 2) },
+            { of(1, 2), of(2, 1)},
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;pairsNotEqualDataProvider&quot;)
+    public void pairsNotEqual(Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p1, Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p2) throws Exception {
+        assertThat(p1).isNotEqualTo(p2);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] pairComparatorDataProvider() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+            { of(2, 3), of(2, 3), 0 },
+            { of(2, 3), of(1, 4), 1 },
+            { of(1, 4), of(2, 3), -1 },
+            { of(1, 3), of(1, 2), 1 },
+            { of(1, 2), of(1, 3), -1 },
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;pairComparatorDataProvider&quot;)
+    public void pairComparator(
+            Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p1,
+            Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt; p2,
+            int compareResult) {
+        final Comparator&lt;Pair&lt;Integer, Integer&gt;&gt; cmp = getPairComparator();
+        assertThat(cmp.compare(p1, p2)).isEqualTo(compareResult);
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilRangeSetTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilRangeSetTestjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/RangeSetTest.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/RangeSetTest.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/RangeSetTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/RangeSetTest.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util;
+
+// FEST-Assert
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.assertThat;
+
+// TestNG
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class RangeSetTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void positive_step1_10elements() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(10, 20, 1); // 10 through 19 inclusive
+        assertThat(range.size()).isEqualTo(10);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void positive_step2_50elements() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(0, 100, 2); // 0 through 98 inclusive, in steps of 2
+        assertThat(range.size()).isEqualTo(50);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void negative_step1_10elements() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(0, -10, -1); // 0 through -9 inclusive
+        assertThat(range.size()).isEqualTo(10);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void negative_step5_24elements() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(-10, -241, -10); // -10 through -240, in steps of -10
+        assertThat(range.size()).isEqualTo(24);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void contains_step5() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(5, 26, 5); // 5 through 25 inclusive
+        assertThat(range.contains(15)).isTrue();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void notContains_step5() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(5, 26, 5); // 5 through 25 inclusive
+        assertThat(range.contains(16)).isFalse();
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void nonsensicalStep() {
+        RangeSet range = new RangeSet(0, 100, -1); // impossible mission
+        assertThat(range.size()).isEqualTo(0);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions=IllegalArgumentException.class)
+    public void illegalStep() {
+        new RangeSet(0, 100, 0); // meet infinity
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilRejectTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilRejectTestjava"></a>

</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.util;
+
+// TestNG
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+// FEST-Assert
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.assertThat;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class RejectTest {
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NullPointerException.class)
+    public void ifNullNull() {
+        Long value = null;
+        Reject.ifNull(value);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NullPointerException.class)
+    public void ifNullNullCustomMessage() {
+        Long value = null;
+        Reject.ifNull(value, &quot;value was null&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void ifNullNotNull() {
+        Long value = Long.MAX_VALUE;
+        Reject.ifNull(value);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void ifNullNotNullCustomMessage() {
+        Long value = Long.MAX_VALUE;
+        Reject.ifNull(value, &quot;value was null&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void checkNotNullNotNull() {
+        Long value = Long.MAX_VALUE;
+        assertThat(Reject.checkNotNull(value)).isSameAs(value);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NullPointerException.class)
+    public void checkNotNullNull() {
+        Long value = null;
+        Reject.checkNotNull(value);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class)
+    public void ifTrueTrue() {
+        Reject.ifTrue(true);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void ifTrueFalse() {
+        Reject.ifTrue(false);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class)
+    public void ifFalseFalse() {
+        Reject.ifFalse(false);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void ifFalseTrue() {
+        Reject.ifFalse(true);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NullPointerException.class)
+    public void ifNullVarArgsStrings() {
+        String[] args = { &quot;hello&quot;, null };
+        Reject.ifNull(args);
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = NullPointerException.class)
+    public void ifNullVarArgsObjects() {
+        Object[] args = { &quot;hello&quot;, null };
+        Reject.ifNull(args);
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>

</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+package org.forgerock.util;
+
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.assertThat;
+import static org.forgerock.util.Utils.joinAsString;
+import static org.forgerock.util.Utils.asEnum;
+
+import java.util.Arrays;
+import java.util.Collections;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class UtilsTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringObject0() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;)).isEqualTo(&quot;&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringObject1() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, 1)).isEqualTo(&quot;1&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringObject2() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, 1, 2)).isEqualTo(&quot;1, 2&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringObject3() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, 1, 2, 3)).isEqualTo(&quot;1, 2, 3&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringIterable0() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, Collections.emptyList())).isEqualTo(&quot;&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringIterable1() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, Collections.singletonList(1))).isEqualTo(&quot;1&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringIterable2() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, Arrays.asList(1, 2))).isEqualTo(&quot;1, 2&quot;);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void joinAsStringStringIterable3() {
+        assertThat(joinAsString(&quot;, &quot;, Arrays.asList(1, 2, 3))).isEqualTo(&quot;1, 2, 3&quot;);
+    }
+
+    enum MyAction {
+        action1, action2, mIxEdCase
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] actionNames() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { &quot;action1&quot;, MyAction.action1 },
+                { &quot;action2&quot;, MyAction.action2 },
+                { &quot;mixedcase&quot;, MyAction.mIxEdCase },
+
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;actionNames&quot;)
+    public void testAsEnum(final String value, final MyAction action) {
+        assertThat(asEnum(value, MyAction.class)).isEqualTo(action);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void testActionRequestAsEnumNullValue() {
+        assertThat(asEnum(null, MyAction.class)).isNull();
+    }
+
+    @Test(expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class)
+    public void testActionRequestAsEnumBadEnumType() {
+        asEnum(&quot;badAction&quot;, MyAction.class);
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilencodeBase64urlTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilencodeBase64urlTestjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/encode/Base64urlTest.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/encode/Base64urlTest.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/encode/Base64urlTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/encode/Base64urlTest.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,60 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.encode;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+import java.nio.charset.Charset;
+
+import static org.testng.Assert.assertEquals;
+import static org.testng.Assert.assertNotSame;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class Base64urlTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldBase64urlEncode() {
+
+        //Given
+        byte[] content = &quot;43uin 98e2 + 343_ {} 43qafdgfREER\\'FDj ionk/.,&lt;&gt;`fj iod Hdfjl&quot;.getBytes(Charset.forName(&quot;UTF-8&quot;));
+        String base64EncodedString = Base64.encode(content);
+
+        //When
+        String encodedString = Base64url.encode(content);
+
+        //Then
+        assertNotSame(encodedString, base64EncodedString);
+        assertEquals(encodedString.split(&quot;-&quot;).length, base64EncodedString.split(&quot;\\+&quot;).length);
+        assertEquals(encodedString.split(&quot;_&quot;).length, base64EncodedString.split(&quot;/&quot;).length);
+        assertEquals(encodedString.indexOf(&quot;=&quot;), -1);
+    }
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldBase54urlDecode() {
+
+        //Given
+        String content1 = &quot;NDN1aW4gOThlMiArIDM0M18ge30gNDNxYWZkZ2ZSRUVSXCdGRGogaW9uay8uLDw-YGZqIGlvZCBIZGZqbA&quot;;
+        String content2 = &quot;NDN1aW4gOThlMiArIDM0M18ge30gNDNxYWZkZ2ZSRUVSXCdGRGogaW9uay8uLDw-YGZqIGlvZCBIZGZqbGE&quot;;
+
+        //When
+        byte[] decodedBytes1 = Base64url.decode(content1);
+        byte[] decodedBytes2 = Base64url.decode(content2);
+
+        //Then
+        assertEquals(new String(decodedBytes1, Charset.forName(&quot;UTF-8&quot;)), &quot;43uin 98e2 + 343_ {} 43qafdgfREER\\'FDj ionk/.,&lt;&gt;`fj iod Hdfjl&quot;);
+        assertEquals(new String(decodedBytes2, Charset.forName(&quot;UTF-8&quot;)), &quot;43uin 98e2 + 343_ {} 43qafdgfREER\\'FDj ionk/.,&lt;&gt;`fj iod Hdfjla&quot;);
+    }
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilqueryQueryFilterParserTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilqueryQueryFilterParserTestjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/query/QueryFilterParserTest.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/query/QueryFilterParserTest.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>
<span class="info">--- forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/query/QueryFilterParserTest.java                                (rev 0)
+++ forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/query/QueryFilterParserTest.java        2015-03-10 09:52:36 UTC (rev 3004)
</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,112 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.query;
+
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.*;
+import static org.forgerock.util.query.QueryFilter.*;
+import static org.mockito.Mockito.*;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+public class QueryFilterParserTest {
+
+    private QueryFilterParser&lt;String&gt; parser = new QueryFilterParser&lt;String&gt;() {
+        @Override
+        protected String parseField(String fieldDescription) {
+            return fieldDescription;
+        }
+    };
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] toIllegalStringData() {
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { &quot;&quot; },
+                { &quot;(&quot; },
+                { &quot;)&quot; },
+                { &quot;()&quot; },
+                { &quot;xxx&quot; },
+                { &quot;x and y&quot; },
+                { &quot;x or y&quot; },
+                { &quot;true and&quot; },
+                { &quot;true or&quot; },
+                { &quot;true and true and&quot; },
+                { &quot;true or false or&quot; },
+                { &quot;nt&quot; },
+                { &quot;foo eq bar&quot; },   // missing quotes
+                { &quot;foo eq \&quot;bar&quot; }, // unmatched quotes
+                { &quot;foo eq bar\&quot;&quot; }, // unmatched quotes
+                { &quot;foo eq&quot; },       // missing value
+                { &quot;foo pr 123&quot; },   // trailing token
+                { &quot;true foo&quot; },     // trailing token
+                { &quot;name op! 123&quot; }, // bad operator
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;toIllegalStringData&quot;, expectedExceptions = IllegalArgumentException.class)
+    public void testValueOfIllegalStrings(String filterString) throws Exception {
+        parser.valueOf(filterString);
+    }
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] toStringData() {
+        // Use longs for integer values because valueOf parses integers as Longs and
+        // equals() is sensitive to the type.
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { alwaysTrue(), &quot;true&quot; },
+                { alwaysFalse(), &quot;false&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;alice&quot;), &quot;/name eq \&quot;alice\&quot;&quot;},
+                { equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age eq 1234&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/balance&quot;, 3.14159), &quot;/balance eq 3.14159&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/isAdmin&quot;, false), &quot;/isAdmin eq false&quot; },
+                { lessThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age lt 1234&quot; },
+                { lessThanOrEqualTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age le 1234&quot; },
+                { greaterThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age gt 1234&quot; },
+                { greaterThanOrEqualTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age ge 1234&quot; },
+                { contains(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;al&quot;), &quot;/name co \&quot;al\&quot;&quot; },
+                { startsWith(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;al&quot;), &quot;/name sw \&quot;al\&quot;&quot; },
+                { present(&quot;/name&quot;), &quot;/name pr&quot; },
+                { or(), &quot;false&quot; }, // zero operand or is always false
+                { and(), &quot;true&quot; }, // zero operand and is always true
+                { or(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L)), &quot;/age eq 1234&quot; }, // single operand or is no-op
+                { and(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L)), &quot;/age eq 1234&quot; }, // single operand and is no-op
+                { or(lessThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 18L), greaterThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 30L)), &quot;(/age lt 18 or /age gt 30)&quot; },
+                { and(lessThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 18L), greaterThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 30L)), &quot;(/age lt 18 and /age gt 30)&quot; },
+                { or(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;)),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; or /role eq \&quot;b\&quot; or /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;)&quot; },
+                { and(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;)),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; and /role eq \&quot;b\&quot; and /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;)&quot; },
+                { or(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), and(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;))),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; or (/role eq \&quot;b\&quot; and /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;))&quot; },
+                { and(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), or(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;))),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; and (/role eq \&quot;b\&quot; or /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;))&quot; },
+                { not(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L)), &quot;! (/age eq 1234)&quot; },
+                { not(not(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L))), &quot;! (! (/age eq 1234))&quot; },
+                { extendedMatch(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;regex&quot;, &quot;al.*&quot;), &quot;/name regex \&quot;al.*\&quot;&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;alice&quot;), &quot;/name eq \&quot;alice\&quot;&quot; },
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;toStringData&quot;)
+    public void testValueOf(QueryFilter filter, String filterString) {
+        assertThat(parser.valueOf(filterString)).isEqualTo(filter);
+    }
+
+}
</ins><span class="cx">\ No newline at end of file
</span></span></pre></div>
<a id="forgerockutilbranches1xutilssrctestjavaorgforgerockutilqueryQueryFilterTestjavafromrev2956forgerockutilbranches1xsrctestjavaorgforgerockutilqueryQueryFilterTestjava"></a>
<div class="copfile"><h4>Copied: forgerock-util/branches/1.x/utils/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/query/QueryFilterTest.java (from rev 2956, forgerock-util/branches/1.x/src/test/java/org/forgerock/util/query/QueryFilterTest.java) (0 => 3004)</h4>
<pre class="diff"><span>

</span><span class="lines">@@ -0,0 +1,81 @@
</span><ins>+/*
+ * The contents of this file are subject to the terms of the Common Development and
+ * Distribution License (the License). You may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
+ *
+ * You can obtain a copy of the License at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. See the License for the
+ * specific language governing permission and limitations under the License.
+ *
+ * When distributing Covered Software, include this CDDL Header Notice in each file and include
+ * the License file at legal/CDDLv1.0.txt. If applicable, add the following below the CDDL
+ * Header, with the fields enclosed by brackets [] replaced by your own identifying
+ * information: &quot;Portions copyright [year] [name of copyright owner]&quot;.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2015 ForgeRock AS.
+ */
+
+package org.forgerock.util.query;
+
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.*;
+import static org.forgerock.util.query.QueryFilter.*;
+
+import org.forgerock.util.promise.Function;
+import org.testng.annotations.DataProvider;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+public class QueryFilterTest {
+
+    @DataProvider
+    public Object[][] toStringData() {
+        // Use longs for integer values because valueOf parses integers as Longs and
+        // equals() is sensitive to the type.
+        return new Object[][] {
+                // @formatter:off
+                { alwaysTrue(), &quot;true&quot; },
+                { alwaysFalse(), &quot;false&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;alice&quot;), &quot;/name eq \&quot;alice\&quot;&quot;},
+                { equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age eq 1234&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/balance&quot;, 3.14159), &quot;/balance eq 3.14159&quot; },
+                { equalTo(&quot;/isAdmin&quot;, false), &quot;/isAdmin eq false&quot; },
+                { lessThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age lt 1234&quot; },
+                { lessThanOrEqualTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age le 1234&quot; },
+                { greaterThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age gt 1234&quot; },
+                { greaterThanOrEqualTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L), &quot;/age ge 1234&quot; },
+                { contains(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;al&quot;), &quot;/name co \&quot;al\&quot;&quot; },
+                { startsWith(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;al&quot;), &quot;/name sw \&quot;al\&quot;&quot; },
+                { present(&quot;/name&quot;), &quot;/name pr&quot; },
+                { or(), &quot;false&quot; }, // zero operand or is always false
+                { and(), &quot;true&quot; }, // zero operand and is always true
+                { or(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L)), &quot;/age eq 1234&quot; }, // single operand or is no-op
+                { and(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L)), &quot;/age eq 1234&quot; }, // single operand and is no-op
+                { or(lessThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 18L), greaterThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 30L)), &quot;(/age lt 18 or /age gt 30)&quot; },
+                { and(lessThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 18L), greaterThan(&quot;/age&quot;, 30L)), &quot;(/age lt 18 and /age gt 30)&quot; },
+                { or(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;)),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; or /role eq \&quot;b\&quot; or /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;)&quot; },
+                { and(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;)),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; and /role eq \&quot;b\&quot; and /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;)&quot; },
+                { or(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), and(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;))),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; or (/role eq \&quot;b\&quot; and /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;))&quot; },
+                { and(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;a&quot;), or(equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;b&quot;), equalTo(&quot;/role&quot;, &quot;c&quot;))),
+                        &quot;(/role eq \&quot;a\&quot; and (/role eq \&quot;b\&quot; or /role eq \&quot;c\&quot;))&quot; },
+                { not(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L)), &quot;! (/age eq 1234)&quot; },
+                { not(not(equalTo(&quot;/age&quot;, 1234L))), &quot;! (! (/age eq 1234))&quot; },
+                { extendedMatch(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;regex&quot;, &quot;al.*&quot;), &quot;/name regex \&quot;al.*\&quot;&quot; },
+                { extendedMatch(&quot;/name&quot;, &quot;eq&quot;, &quot;alice&quot;), &quot;/name eq \&quot;alice\&quot;&quot; },
+                // @formatter:on
+        };
+    }
+
+    @Test(dataProvider = &quot;toStringData&quot;)
+    public void testToString(QueryFilter filter, String filterString) {
+        assertThat(filter.toString()).isEqualTo(filterString);
+    }
+
+    private static final Function&lt;String, String, RuntimeException&gt; IDENTITY_FUNCTION =
+            new Function&lt;String, String, RuntimeException&gt;() {
+        @Override
+        public String apply(String value) throws RuntimeException {
+            return value;
+        }
+    };
+
+}
</ins></span></pre></div>

+package org.forgerock.util.thread;

+import org.forgerock.util.thread.listener.ShutdownListener;
+import org.forgerock.util.thread.listener.ShutdownManager;
+import static org.mockito.Matchers.any;
+import org.mockito.Mockito;
+import static org.mockito.Mockito.verify;
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+public class ExecutorServiceFactoryTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldRegisterWithShutdownManager() {
+        ShutdownManager mockWrapper = Mockito.mock(ShutdownManager.class);
+        new ExecutorServiceFactory(mockWrapper).createFixedThreadPool(1);
+        verify(mockWrapper).addShutdownListener(any(ShutdownListener.class));
+    }
+
+
+}

+package org.forgerock.util.time;
+
+import static org.fest.assertions.Assertions.assertThat;
+
+import org.testng.annotations.Test;
+
+@SuppressWarnings(&quot;javadoc&quot;)
+public class TimeServiceTest {
+
+    @Test
+    public void shouldComputesElapsedTime() throws Exception {
+        long past = System.currentTimeMillis() - 100;
+        long elapsed = TimeService.SYSTEM.since(past);
+
+        assertThat(elapsed &gt;= 100).isTrue();
+    }
+}
